text: 第一章 当我还只有六岁的时候，在一本描写原始森林的名叫《真实的故事》的书中， 看到了一副精彩的插画，画的是一条蟒蛇正在吞食一只大野兽。
translation: Chapter 1 When I was six years old, I once saw an amazing picture in a book about life in the jungle, called “True Stories”. It showed a boa constrictor who was swallowing an animal.

text: 页头上就是那副 画的摹本。
translation: Here is a copy of the picture:

text: 这本书中写道：“这些蟒蛇把它们的猎获物不加咀嚼地囫囵吞下，尔后就不能再动弹了；它们就在长长的六个月的睡眠中消化这些食物。”
translation: And here’s what it said in the book: “Boa constrictors swallow their prey whole without chewing it.

text: 当时，我对丛林中的奇遇想得很多，于是，我也用彩色铅笔画出了我的第一 副图画。
translation: I thought a lot about the adventures of the jungle, and after a while I took a coloured pencil and drew my first picture.

text: 我的第一号作品。
translation: My picture number 1.

text: 它是这样的： 我把我的这副杰作拿给大人看，我问他们我的画是不是叫他们害怕。
translation: It looked like this: I showed my masterpiece to the grown-ups and I asked them if my drawing scared them.

text: 他们回答我说：“一顶帽子有什么可怕的？”
translation: “Scared? Why would I be scared of a hat?”

text: 我画的不是帽子，是一条巨蟒在消化着一头大象。
translation: It was supposed to be a boa constrictor who had swallowed an elephant.

text: 于是我又把巨蟒肚子里的情况画了出来，以便让大人们能够看懂。
translation: So I drew the inside of the boa constrictor, to help the grown-up people understand.

text: 这些大人总是需要解释。
translation: You always have to explain things to them.

text: 我的第二号作品是这样的： 大人们劝我把这些画着开着肚皮的，或闭上肚皮的蟒蛇的图画放在一边，还是把兴趣放在地理、历史、算术、语法上。
translation: My drawing number 2 looked like this: The grown-up people told me I should stop drawing pictures of boa constrictors from the outside and the inside and instead concentrate on geography, history, maths and English.

text: 就这样，在六岁的那年，我就放弃了 当画家这一美好的职业。
translation: So at the age of six I had to give up my brilliant career as a painter.

text: 我的第一号、第二号作品的不成功，使我泄了气。 这些大人们，靠他们自己什么也弄不懂，还得老是不断地给他们作解释。
translation: I was too discouraged by the way people treated my drawing number 1 and my drawing number 2. Grown-up people never understand anything on their own.

text: 后来，我只好选择了另外一个职业，我学会了开飞机，世界各地差不多都飞 到过。
translation: It’s so tiring for children to go on and on explaining everything. I had to find something else to do, and I learned to fly planes. I’ve flown all over the world.

text: 的确，地理学帮了我很大的忙。
translation: And it’s true, geography has been pretty useful.

text: 我一眼就能分辨出中国和亚里桑那。
translation: At a glance, I can tell China from Arizona.

text: 要是夜里迷失了航向，这是很有用的。
translation: That’s handy if you’ve got lost during the night.

text: 这样，在我的生活中，我跟许多严肃的人有过很多的接触。
translation: During my life, I’ve come into contact with a whole bunch of serious people.

text: 我在大人们中间 生活过很长时间。
translation: I’ve met a lot of grown-ups.

text: 我仔细地观察过他们，但这并没有使我对他们的看法有多大的 改变。
translation: I’ve got to know them well. It hasn’t improved my opinion of them much.

text: 当我遇到一个头脑看来稍微清楚的大人时，我就拿出一直保存着的我那第一号作品来测试测试他。
translation: When I find one who seems a bit different from the others, I try the experiment of showing them my drawing number 1, which I’ve always kept.

text: 我想知道他是否真的有理解能力。
translation: I want to know if they really understand anything.

text: 可是，得到的回答总是： “这是顶帽子。”
translation: But they always answer: “It’s a hat.”

text: 我就不和他谈巨蟒呀，原始森林呀，或者之类的事。
translation: So then I don’t talk to them about boa constrictors or jungles or stars.

text: 我只得迁就他们的水平，和他们谈些桥牌呀，高尔夫球呀，政治呀，领带呀这些。
translation: I go down to their level. I talk to them about bridge and golf and politics and neckties.

text: 于是大人们就十分高兴能认识我这样一个通情达理的人。
translation: And the grown-up is very happy to find I’m a serious person too.
